BBEX3.A.CDF.USD.CA.AC.A04: Exchange rates for the US dollar in the Democratic Republic of the Congo * / USD 1 = CDF ... (middle)
General: * Referred to as indicative rates until December 2008. On 30 June 1998, the Congo franc was introduced as legal tender at a rate of 100,000 new zaires (ZRN) = 1 Congo franc (CDF).

Source: Since 2009 Banque Centrale du Congo, Kinshasa September 2006 - December 2008 Fortis Bank, Brüssel January 1999 - August 2006 Banque Commerciale du Congo, Kinshasa, and Banque Belgolaise, Brüssel
Methodology: Until 2008 calculated on the basis of month-end rates, from 2009 on the basis of month-end buying and selling rates.

Comment on 1998: On 30 June 1998, the Congo franc was introduced as legal tender at a rate of 100,000 new zaires (ZRN) = 1 Congo franc (CDF);  to calculate the annual average, the rates set in ZRN were converted at a rate of 100,000:1 and included in the calculation.
Comment on 1999: On 6 April 1999, the Congo franc was devalued by 36.0%.
Comment on 2000: On 22 January 2000, the Congo franc was devalued by 48.8%, on 10 June 2000 by 61.7% and on 24 October 2000 by 53.0%.

Comment on 2001: On 28 May 2001, the Congo franc was devalued sharply and the exchange rates were allowed to float freely. Calculated using the exchange rates from 25 May (USD 1 = CDF 50.00) and 28 May (USD 1 = CDF 310.00), the Congo franc was devalued by 83.9%
